column1: 2020-10-01 21:37:56#world#This One Habit Will Make You Seem More Confident Immediately#https://www.yahoo.com/lifestyle/one-habit-seem-more-confident-213756356.html#https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/KTa5VyV.wRc4NAFhpJiSyA--~B/aD04MDA7dz0xMjAwO2FwcGlkPXl0YWNoeW9u/https://media.zenfs.com/en-US/best_life_342/3bb7b7619cd41ec1bd382b97926b9c38#en#1.0#www.yahoo.com#"Most people want to appear confident to those around them.  Confidence is a desirable trait—it can make you seem happier
column2: smarter
column3: and even more attractive.  Luckily
column4: you don't necessarily need to have confidence to make other people think that you do.  In fact
column5: you can literally fake it until you make it
column6: just by plastering a smile on your face.  Experts say that simply making smiling a habit can immediately make you seem more confident to other people.  Read on to find out why
column7: and for behaviors to avoid
column8: ditch This Habit That Makes You Seem Less Confident to Others. ""When people see you smiling
column9: they assume everything's going well and perceive your facial expression as a moniker for success
column10: says Bryan Bruno
column11: MD
column12: medical director at Mid City TMS in New York.  ""A smile will make people trust your decisions and feel supported by you because it is a universal sign that you are worry-free. ""People may also view your smile as a positive indicator of confidence because it makes them ""feel more at ease and welcoming
column15: science consultant for Abova Health and founder of Oral Care Perfected.  This is because smiling is literally contagious. A 2016 study published in Trends in Cognitive Sciences found that smiling makes everyone around you feel better
column16: as they are usually either consciously or unconsciously smiling with you.  According to the researchers
column17: this is because people have an instinct for facial mimicry
column18: which is where someone imitates the facial expressions of others. Balanoff says a smile can do more than just make you appear more confident and make people want to be around you.  It can also help you feel more confident. ""Nothing gives you more instant and immediate confidence than displaying a smile
column19: Balanoff explains.  ""Our body and mind respond with a cascade of hormones that will lift your spirit when this happens. ""RELATED: For more up-to-date information
column20: sign up for our daily newsletter. It's true
column21: and it's backed by science.  ""Pulling your face muscles together into a smile will trigger your brain to release endorphins
column24: a neurologist from IGEA Brain and Spine
column25: explained to NBC in 2017 that through his research
column26: he found that the simple act of smiling can produce a chemical reaction in the brain
column28: such as dopamine and serotonin. ""These 'happy hormones' can ease your perception of pain
column31: boost your confidence by making you feel good about yourself
column32: Bruno says.  ""Taking a moment to smile throughout your day will chemically enhance your perception of events and make you feel more confident over time. "" And for more ways to seem self-assured
column33: stop saying these Words That Make You Sound Less Confident

2020-09-29 17:38:42#world#Curious Deer Watches Closely as Michigan Woman Sinks Golf Putt#https://www.yahoo.com/lifestyle/curious-deer-watches-closely-michigan-173842666.html#https://s.yimg.com/hd/cp-video-transcode/prod/2020-09/29/5f737195c485b325826bed2f/5f7371963a3d41000152492a_612x1080_FES_v1.jpg#en#1.0#www.yahoo.com#PGA pro Jason Michael Dudzinski and his fiancee
column2: Katie Nolff
column3: were enjoying a day of golf on September 27 in Oakland County
column4: Michigan
column5: when a young deer wandered onto the course. Dudzinski posted a video to his Facebook page showing the deer walking right up to Nolff just as she is setting up for her last shot of the day. “This has never happened before to either of us
column6: ” Dudzinski told Storyful.  “I was a little surprised as I was watching her out there and happened to glance over and see the deer approaching the green.  I was a little nervous as you never know how deer might react
column7: but Katie is an animal whisperer.  It was an encounter is if she was petting a dog
column8: ” he said. Nolff says hello to the buck and lets it smell her hand before she sets up again
column9: and sinks her shot. The deer sticks around while Nolff and Dudzinski retrieve the ball
column10: as Nolff suggests that perhaps the animal wants to play with them
column11: and proceeds to pick up and throw the ball for the deer
column12: who is apparently not into fetch. The couple had celebrated their upcoming nuptials with friends and family earlier in the day
column13: and told Storyful that they thought the deer could be the spirit of Nolff’s late father stopping by to wish them well.  Credit: Jason Michael Dudzinski via Storyful#https://sunnybot.org/goodnews/web/en/zptdWpwSs#zptdWpwSs#63#6#15751#0#0

column2: and also given the little cat the best seat in the house as she plays. Rémila the kitten was abandoned
column3: Esther Abrami said
column4: and rescued by the shelter Association Féli-Cité in Aix-en-Provence.  Her family acted as the kitten’s host
column5: she said on Instagram.  “When she arrived she was less than 400 grams
column6: scared and had breathing issues from having stayed outside for several days.  I’m happy to say that after seven days of milk bottles and constant cuddles Rémila has now become one of the friendliest cats I’ve ever seen. ”The only problem was that she refused to be left on the floor
column7: Abrami said.  But
column8: as this video of her playing Fauré’s Aprés un Rêve shows
column9: she found the perfect solution.  Rémila is by turns rapt and napping in her fanny pack as she plays.  Credit: Esther Abrami via Storyful#https://sunnybot.org/goodnews/web/en/wOSqr6ymS#wOSqr6ymS#156#8#1561#0#0

column1: 2020-09-28 09:57:19#world#Meet the Australian millionaire who invented a flying car inspired by Star Wars#https://www.yahoo.com/lifestyle/meet-australian-millionaire-invented-flying-095719877.html#https://s.yimg.com/ny/api/res/1.2/lLo4VqWdMKb8oeoRU8ztEw--/YXBwaWQ9aGlnaGxhbmRlcjt3PTEyODA7aD04MDA-/https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/0gEGkn_F842F3e1CiXV6kA--~B/aD0xODAwO3c9Mjg3OTthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--/https://media.zenfs.com/en-GB/the_telegraph_818/92c4d2e1deae5acb2acf15d04ae05886#en#1.0#www.yahoo.com#Technology entrepreneur Matt Pearson was searching for a new challenge after his internet business Honcho made him a multi-millionaire.  A science fiction fan inspired by Elon Musk’s Tesla
column2: he set his sights on designing an electric flying car.  Now his Airspeeder racing series is being touted as the future of motorsport.  The F1 of the skies will see manned
column3: open cockpit ‘multicopters’ competing at speeds of up to 80mph in a Star Wars-style aerial dual.  Pearson hopes it will one day inspire the possibility of domestic flying cars.  An Airspeeder features a set of rotor blades at each corner and has the ability to take off and land vertically
column4: just like a helicopter.  Roughly the size of a bobsleigh
column5: the batteries last about ten minutes and pilots will need to swap machines at regular pit stops during races.  Dangerous? Not a bit
column6: as the company behind the idea
column7: Alauda Aeronautics
column8: has developed collision avoidance technology
column9: similar to systems already starting to appear in semi-autonomous cars we already drive on the road. #https://sunnybot.org/goodnews/web/en/QU3olkwU3#QU3olkwU3#92#1#2091#0#0

column1: 2020-09-24 05:36:00#world#Minnesota 5-year-old finishes quest to visit 67 waterfalls#https://www.yahoo.com/lifestyle/minnesota-5-old-finishes-quest-053600620.html#https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/k2QItjRIFNB06yhWNGT6bw--~B/aD01NjA7dz04NDA7YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b24-/https://media.zenfs.com/en/the_week_574/156068e5e1801d110115502d291a8235#en#1.0#www.yahoo.com#"When Wynn Radke's mom
column2: Colleen
column3: told her to pick an outdoor activity they could do together during quarantine
column4: the 5-year-old came up with an ambitious plan to visit 67 waterfalls. ""I told her we weren't going to sit around and watch YouTube all summer
column5: Colleen Radke told KARE 11.  When asked how she came up with the idea to see 67 waterfalls
column6: Wynn said simply
column7: ""Just thought of it in my brain. ""The Radkes live in Minneapolis
column8: and over the course of five months
column9: they traveled across Minnesota and into western Wisconsin to visit waterfalls
column10: starting at Fairy Falls in March and ending at Winnewissa Falls in August.  While some waterfalls were visible from roads
column11: other times Wynn and Colleen had to hike several miles in order to see the cascading water. Colleen recently went back to work after being furloughed
column12: and she's grateful for the five months she spent chasing waterfalls with Wynn
column13: especially since it came as she was finalizing a stressful divorce.  ""It was just a really fun time for the two of us to bond and grow and heal together
column14: she said.  More stories from theweek. com America needs to hear the bad news first A mild defense of Republican hypocrisy on the Supreme Court Trump is the only one being honest about the Supreme Court fight"#https://sunnybot.org/goodnews/web/en/6kDItMdHb#6kDItMdHb#228#10#3212#0#0

blackberry and tahini cake recipe#https://www.yahoo.com/lifestyle/fig-blackberry-tahini-cake-recipe-145443067.html#https://s.yimg.com/ny/api/res/1.2/tmeGkd0yGxRo0oCFYsVxeQ--/YXBwaWQ9aGlnaGxhbmRlcjt3PTEyODA7aD04MDA-/https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/caQGsa1FOeOpbncC7PL_.w--~B/aD0xMzczO3c9MjE5ODthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--/https://media.zenfs.com/en-GB/the_telegraph_818/354608a131cce5ccddc7d7e3d00811be#en#1.0#www.yahoo.com#Both figs with their gooey innards and plump blackberries are at their best around this time
column3: and are just sweet enough to balance the nutty tahini.  Prep time: 35 minutes | Cooking time: 45 minutes SERVES eight INGREDIENTS For the cake 225g plain flour 1½ tsp baking powder Pinch of salt 200g unsalted butter 200g light brown sugar 1 tsp vanilla extract 60g tahini 3 eggs 50ml milk For the topping 160g mascarpone 80g icing sugar 1 tsp vanilla extract 50ml double cream For decorating 4–6 figs
column4: quartered Handful of blackberries 1 tsp sesame seeds
column5: lightly toasted METHOD Preheat the oven to 180C/160C fan/Gas 4.  Grease a round 23cm cake pan and line with baking parchment.  To make the cake
column6: sift together the flour
column7: baking powder and salt into a small bowl and set aside.  Using a stand mixer or electric whisk
column8: cream together the butter
column9: sugar and vanilla for five minutes
column10: or until pale and creamy.  Add the tahini and beat for one minute
column11: or until combined.  Add the eggs one at a time
column12: beating well after each addition and scraping down the bowl every so often.  With the mixer on low speed
column13: pour in half of the flour
column14: followed by the milk.  Pour in the remainder of the flour and beat gently until combined.  Pour the batter into the prepared pan and bake for 30-35 minutes
column15: or until the cake is a deep golden brown on top and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.  Leave the cake to cool before removing from the pan.  To make the topping
column16: add the mascarpone and icing sugar to a small bowl and mix by hand with a spatula or spoon until smooth.  Stir in the vanilla extract and double cream to loosen it up before using an offset spatula to spread the mascarpone evenly on top of the cake.  To decorate
column17: arrange the figs and blackberries in a crescent shape along one side of the cake.  Finish with a sprinkle of sesame seeds.  Recipe from The New Way to Cake by Benjamina Ebuehi (Page Street Publishing

column1: 2020-09-19 04:04:52#world#The Best Secret Menu Option at McDonald's#https://www.yahoo.com/lifestyle/best-secret-menu-option-mcdonalds-040452577.html#https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/k3ReXWrkk3vvVhGwEpXP8g--~B/aD04Nzk7dz0xMjAwO2FwcGlkPXl0YWNoeW9u/https://media.zenfs.com/en-US/galvanized/0cb811d7aaf59e8b73f9f3a29b050497#en#1.0#www.yahoo.com#You probably know about Starbucks' secret menu
column2: which includes tons of candy-flavored Frappuccinos and super sweet lattes
column3: but did you know there are ways to get special dishes at McDonald's that aren't on the menu
column4: too? It's true! By using some ordering hacks
column5: doing some assembling yourself
column6: and being extra kind to the person behind the counter
column7: you can create the McDonald's secret menu items of your dreams. Struggling to decide between an apple pie or a McFlurry for dessert? Put them together for an Apple Pie McFlurry.  In the mood for both breakfast and lunch? Then get yourself a McBrunch Burger.  It's time to combine different menu items for maximum McDonald's deliciousness.  Because while Big Macs and McGriddles are great
column8: these McDonald's secret menu items might be even better. And for more
column9: don't miss these 15 Classic American Desserts That Deserve a Comeback. 1 McBrunch BurgerWhat to order: Cheeseburger or double cheeseburger
column10: round or folded egg
column11: and a hashbrownIf you can't decide between a breakfast sandwich and a burger
column12: you can always build your own McBrunch Burger.  Just order a regular or double burger and add an egg and a hashbrown to it.  You might have to assemble it yourself
column13: but it's worth it. RELATED: Sign up for our newsletter to get daily recipes and food news in your inbox!2 Orange CreamsicleWhat to order: Soft serve and orange FantaThe secret McDonald's Orange Creamsicle is just a splash of orange Fanta on your vanilla soft serve.  But this is another order you'll have to make at the counter because you can't add Fanta onto your ice cream on the McDonald's app either.  We have to warn you that when you make this odd request
column14: you might end up getting charged for a drink.  But if your McDonald's has a Coca-Cola Freestyle machine
column15: you can always create an Orange Creamsicle by adding the Fanta yourself. RELATED: Your ultimate restaurant and supermarket survival guide is here!3 Surf&Turf BurgerWhat to order: Cheeseburger and Filet-O-FishWho needs steak and shrimp when you can have a burger patty and a Filet-O-Fish patty on one massive sandwich
column16: thanks to this McDonald's secret menu item?4 Land
column20: one Filet-O-FishIf you want to take the Surf&Turf Burger to the next level
column21: throw in a McChicken and combine all three patties to make a Frankenstein-style secret McDonald's sandwich.  Because you'll have to assemble this one yourself
column22: you can add in another bun (or two) in the middle
column23: Big Mac-style. 5 Big McChickenWhat to order: Big Mac and three McChickensIs the Land
column25: &Air Burger still not enough protein for you? Try this McDonald's secret menu item instead: the Big McChicken.  To create this monstrosity
column26: you'll have to order a Big Mac and three (yes
column27: three) McChickens.  When you get your sandwiches
column28: replace the buns with the McChicken patties.  It will get messy
column29: but it will definitely help you hit that daily protein goal. RELATED: The easy way to make healthier comfort foods. 6 Ice Cream SandwichWhat to order: McFlurry of your choice and two chocolate chip cookiesYou don't have to go to a fancy artisan ice cream shop to get an ice cream sandwich.  You can make one at McDonald's by adding a couple of spoonfuls of a McFlurry between two chocolate chip cookies.  It will get messy
column30: but it will also be delicious. 7 Hashbrown McMuffinWhat to order: McMuffin sandwich of your choice and a hashbrownReally
column31: what isn't better with a crunchy McDonald's hashbrown? Just order your favorite McMuffin sandwich and add a hashbrown into it and voila: Hashbrown McMuffin. 8 Apple Pie McFlurryWhat to order: Plain McFlurry and an apple pieThis McDonald's secret menu item requires some effort from employees
column32: so it's probably not the best thing to order if there's a huge line behind you.  That said
column33: all you have to do is order an apple pie blended into a plain McFlurry.  But if the employee doesn't seem game
column34: you can always mash it in yourself. 9 McCrepeWhat to order: Stack of Hotcakes and Fruit 'N Yogurt ParfaitIf you want a budget brunch
column35: the McCrepe is a pretty easy McDonald's menu hack.  Simply order a Fruit 'N Yogurt Parfait and put it on top of a stack of McDonald's Hotcakes.  And there you have it!10 Poor Man's Big MacWhat to order: McDouble with no ketchup
column36: add lettuce and Big Mac SauceIf you love Big Mac sauce but don't want that extra bun in the middle of your burger
column37: you can save a bit of money by tricking out a McDouble instead to create the Poor Man's Big Mac.  You'll have to order this one at the counter because you can't add Big Mac sauce to a McDouble through the McDonald's app.  We promise it's worth it

column4: smart
column5: and popular parrot who loves to talk and entertain! He knows the names of several animals and likes to make their sounds.  In addition to his silly vocalizations

column7: talking

column9: and acting silly.  He also enjoys singing and dancing in some of his video compilations.  With his amazing talking abilities and funny antics
column10: Einstein the talking parrot’s videos will keep you entertained for hours! Einstein parrot is also famous for some of his silly quotes and sayings.  Online
column11: Einstein
column12: the talking parrot is popular across many social media platforms.  Einstein’s favorite places to talk at home is perched on the shower wall
column13: in the kitchen on his drawer
column14: and on his screened-in back porch.  As stated on his website
column15: Einstein’s mission statement: “To entertain and bring joy
column17: and to convey that parrots are deserving of immeasurable amounts of patience
column20: einsteinparrot. com is designed to inform you about the care of parrots and also entertain you.  As previously mentioned
column21: Einstein is popular on many social media sites such as YouTube @einsteinparrot
column24: and Facebook @einsteintexanparrot.  Living with a parrot is a big commitment.  Parrots live a very long time.  A parrot such as Einstein can live to be 50 or 60 years old.  Many larger parrots like Macaws can live to be 100 years old.  They all require a lot of care
column28: and patience.  Parrots need a lot of attention and lots of toys and activities to keep from being bored.  Parrots are also expensive
column29: a large cage is an investment
column30: and plenty of play perches to spend out of cage time.  Specialized veterinarian care is also required.  Most of all they require your companionship and a forever home.  Many people decide after the first few years of parrot ownership that the responsibility is too great and the parrots become neglected and sometimes abandoned.  When that happens they are sent to parrot rescue facilities to be adopted by a new family or some spend their lives in sanctuaries.  It is often said

column1: 2020-09-16 02:42:03#world#25 Forgotten Desserts That Deserve a Comeback#https://www.yahoo.com/lifestyle/25-forgotten-desserts-deserve-comeback-024203453.html#https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/BxEQtC6YxDAJfu8q.v5szg--~B/aD04Nzk7dz0xMjAwO2FwcGlkPXl0YWNoeW9u/https://media.zenfs.com/en-US/galvanized/8ff17ef93140509b6bcabd7fce23743c#en#1.0#www.yahoo.com#"In uncertain times
column2: there's comfort in the familiar—it's no surprise that comfort foods have been popular during the quarantine.  But familiarity isn't all we love about these 25 beloved but all-but-forgotten desserts.  They were great when we were growing up
column3: and they're just as delicious now. Read on as we make our case for giving these retro classics the comeback that we believe are their ""just desserts. "" And for more
column4: don't miss these 15 Classic American Desserts. 1 Cream PiesCan we take just a moment here to wax reverential about the single-crusted
column5: whipped-cream-topped
column6: custard-based wonder that is cream pie? The cream pie came into existence as a way of using up surplus eggs and milk products from the family farm (think: buttermilk pie
column7: chess pie
column8: and sugar cream pies) and blossomed into ubiquity as shelf-stable cocoa
column9: coconut
column10: and bananas became more and more widely available. By the mid-20th century
column11: mile-high cream pies had become one of the defining features of classic diner culture.  If cream pies have lost ground in the intervening decades
column12: it can only be because so many other desserts have cropped up to distract us.  And that just seems wrong.  So
column14: starting with our surprisingly healthy recipe for Coconut Cream Pie. RELATED: Sign up for our newsletter to get daily recipes and food news in your inbox!2 French Fruit TartsSpeaking of cream pies
column15: who else remembers the classic French fruit tart
column18: a single-crusted custard pie topped with sugar-glazed fresh fruit? Back in the 1980s
column21: mildly-flavored sweet was a staple of dessert carts and also managed to pass as a brunch selection at some of the fancier hotels. Maybe it wasn't the healthiest brunch choice
column22: but the French fruit tart certainly was—and remains—an attractive
column23: delicious vehicle for fresh berries.  Let's start putting this back on dessert plates today
column24: starting with our recipe for Fruit and Cream Tarts. RELATED: Sign up for our newsletter to get daily recipes and food news in your inbox!3 Southern-Style Banana PuddingIn the South
column25: banana pudding is neither banana nor pudding.  It's vanilla custard layered with banana slices and vanilla wafers.  The wafers become delightfully soggy
column26: like the Ritz crackers in old fashioned ""mock apple pie"" or the chocolate wafers in ""icebox cake. "" It's hard to find this old-fashioned
column27: Southern granny-approved treat outside the American South
column28: but we have a wonderful Banana Pudding Recipe. Don't miss these 50 Best Vintage Recipes from the South. 4 Apple CrispWarm
column29: cinnamon-scented comfort food made of stewed apples and topped with a sweet
column31: granola-like crust… is there anything better? Apple crisp caught on during the 20th century as an alternative to apple pie and became hugely popular in the 1980s when Americans learned President Reagan was a fan of its Southern cousin
column32: Apple Brown Betty.  Its popularity as a vehicle for vanilla ice cream was later eclipsed by bread pudding and all its iterations.  But apples are much more nutritious than bread
column33: especially if you don't peel them
column34: so this one gets our vote for a well-deserved comeback. Get our recipe for an Apple Cranberry Crisp.  5 Fruit CobblerLike apple crisp
column35: fruit cobblers have found themselves unfairly upstaged by the constant parade of newer and richer takes on dessert (hello
column37: we're talking about you).  But just because fruit cobblers aren't so easy to find these days
column38: that doesn't mean you can't make this tasty
column40: especially if you happen to have a wonderful recipe handy. Get our recipe for Blueberry Peach Cobbler.  How many of these 33 nostalgic childhood snacks do you remember?6 Apple TurnoverEven if you'd never consider eating an apple turnover out of your hand
column44: hand pies have been around since ancient times
column45: although it appears no one thought to use apples and puff pastry until sometime during the 19th century.  What makes us wish it were more readily available these days is that it's inherently portion-controllable.  Luckily
column46: we've got a great Apple Turnover Recipe. 7 Sticky Toffee PuddingSticky toffee pudding
column49: steamed dessert combining toffee and dates
column50: first came into vogue during the 1970s in the U. K.  Unfortunately
column51: it seems to have lost quite a bit of ""steam"" since then.  But why not bring it back
column52: especially if it's in the form of a fiber-rich cake studded with sweet pears and dates? This treat is best enjoyed it with a nice cup of joe. Get our recipe for Sticky Toffee Date Cake.  And why is it that no one makes these 15 retro summer foods anymore?8 Molten Chocolate CakeMolten chocolate cake
column54: is a chocolate cake with a thick
column56: lava-like chocolate center that ""erupts"" when the cake is cracked with a fork.  It was first introduced to Americans in the 1980s at top-tier French restaurants in New York City.  Most of those restaurants are long gone
column57: and you don't see lava cake around much anymore either.  But we miss it.  That's why we learned to make it ourselves. Get our recipe for Molten Chocolate Cake.  9 Bananas FosterBananas Foster
column58: in which bananas are sautéed in a combination of sugar
column60: and rum and then set aflame—briefly
column61: to burn off only the alcohol content—was invented in the 1950s at Brennan's restaurant in New Orleans.  It quickly caught ""fire"" throughout the rest of the country
column63: enthusiasm for the theatrical dessert waned.  Although you can still find Bananas Foster at Brennan's
column64: it's rarely seen on menus elsewhere.  But if you're missing the flavor of warm
column66: we have a recipe that delivers precisely that. Get our recipe for Banana Walnut Bourbon French Toast.  10 Traditional Coca-Cola CakeCoca-Cola Cake
column71: moist chocolate cake topped with sweet
column72: gooey chocolate glaze.  It first appeared as a printed recipe in the 1950s and enjoyed a comeback when Cracker Barrel added it to the menu in 1997.  It's been keeping a fairly low profile these days
column74: but we'd love to see that change. Get our recipe for Traditional Coca-Cola Cake.  11 BlondiesIn 1896
column76: except they weren't brown in color because they had no chocolate in them.  Rather
column77: they were golden and tasted of molasses.  The name ""brownie"" referred to a mythical elfin creature; ""brownies"" were ""Brownie's Food. "" Those first ""brownies"" were what we think of today as ""blondies. "" Chocolate brownies
column78: which are what we think of when we think of ""brownies
column79: were invented nearly a full decade later.  Despite blondies having come first
column80: they've grown less popular as the world has become increasingly enamored with chocolate.  We understand the love for chocolate
column82: we think it would be great if blondies could make a comeback. Get our recipe for Chocolate Chip Blondies.  12 SnickerdoodlesSnickerdoodles are sugar cookies coated in sugar and cinnamon.  Invented in 1891
column83: they were an immediate sensation.  Like blondies
column84: snickerdoodles now suffer from the popularity-undermining affliction known as ""not being made of chocolate. "" And
column86: snickerdoodles deserve better. Get our recipe for Snickerdoodle Cookies.  13 Oatmeal CookiesOatmeal cookies have been around far longer than chocolate chip cookies.  But while they've had their moments in the spotlight
column87: oatmeal cookies have always been the ""Jan"" to chocolate chip cookies' ""Marcia. "" And fans of television's early '70s hit The Brady Bunch know that it's always ""Marcia
column92: we believe oatmeal cookies have gotten a raw deal.  Let's give them a little love
column93: even if it means adding some chocolate chips to the batter. Get our recipe for Oatmeal Chocolate Chip Cookies.  14 Gingerbread CookiesGingerbread cookies have been around since the mid-17th century
column94: which is to say they were making mouths happy long before all those ""more popular"" cookies were even born.  Of course
column95: we all know what happened.  As those other cookies came into being
column97: while gingerbread cookies increasingly became ""yesterday's news. "" But we believe gingerbread cookies deserve better
column98: especially when they're homemade and iced. Get our recipe for Gingerbread Cookies.  15 Lemon Chiffon CakeLight
column101: lemon chiffon cake was invented in the mid-1920s
column102: but its recipe was kept a secret until 1947 when Betty Crocker shared it with the world.  Sadly
column103: that was lemon chiffon cake's big moment
column104: and it has not seen anything even close to that level of popularity since.  We think that might change
column106: once word gets around you can make it in an Instant Pot. Get our recipe for Instant Pot Lemon Cake
column107: and don't miss these 20 Instant Pot hacks every cook should know. 16 Banana SplitPutting ice cream into a banana boat and topping it with chocolate sauce
column109: and cherry wasn't just a good idea when the banana split was invented in 1907.  It was a genius idea then
column110: and it continues to be now
column111: even if the good ole banana split has been
column114: more elaborate ice cream desserts. Get our recipe for a Grilled Banana Split.  17 Malt-Shop Style MilkshakesSpeaking of ice cream concoctions
column115: let's not forget the old-fashioned milkshakes they used to make to order in malt shops from days gone by.  You'd sit at the counter
column117: and watch as the ""soda jerk"" (as he was called without derision) grabbed a metal shaker
column118: plopped in some vanilla ice cream
column120: and then whipped up your milkshake using an old-fashioned milkshake machine.  These days
column121: milkshakes tend to be churned out like soft-serve from pre-made mixes at fast food joints.  But who's to say you can't make them the good old-fashioned way yourself?Get our recipe for Old-Fashioned Milkshakes.  18 Baked AlaskaOne of America's most iconic desserts
column122: Baked Alaska is ice cream surrounded by cake surrounded by meringue that's either browned quickly in the oven or given the flambé treatment tableside.  Baked Alaska attained its peak popularity in the mid-20th century
column123: but because it's essentially ice cream cake enveloped in meringue (which consists of sweetened whipped egg whites) and offers an occasion to create quite a spectacle (if you decide to go the flambé route)
column124: we can't figure out why it's not more widely available these days.  For now
column125: you can find a recipe for a brownie-based Baked Alaska from Sally's Baking Addiction. 19 Crêpes SuzetteCrêpes Suzette is another fun
column127: flambé dessert from days gone by.  Perfect in its simplicity
column128: it's a crepe doused in butter and orange-flavored liqueur and then set dramatically aflame (to burn off most of the alcohol in the liqueur while imparting a deep orange flavor into the dessert itself). It's difficult to find a classic recipe for this beloved blast from the past
column129: but this one from Half-Baked Harvest is pretty close
column130: although it's served drizzled with yogurt rather than set aflame
column132: it uses Meyer lemon.  If it's the deep orange flavor you seek
column133: you might want to give our Cinnamon Orange Lava Cakes recipe a whirl. 20 Pineapple Upside-Down CakeAlthough Hawaii didn't become a state until 1959
column135: James Dole had built his first pineapple cannery
column137: canned pineapple bad become so ubiquitous in the U. S.  that pineapple upside-down cake (so named because when it's baking
column138: the pineapple is at the bottom of the cake) became a trend. Get the recipe from Averie Cooks.  21 Chocolate FondueFondue dates back to 17th century Switzerland
column140: it was made with cheese.  But chocolate fondue was invented in the early 1960s right here in the U. S.
column141: immediately becoming a huge trend among the hip
column142: giving rise to ""fondue parties"" and restaurants devoted entirely to fondue.  Today
column144: which is unfortunate because it's fun to play with your food
column145: and it's a delicious delivery system for fresh fruit.  If you'd like to throw a fondue party
column146: you can find an easy recipe for chocolate fondue at Chelsea's Messy Apron
column147: or if you prefer to serve your fruit pre-dipped
column148: then we highly recommend our recipe for Dark Chocolate Dipped Bananas. 22 Black Forest CakeBlack Forest Cake
column149: which dates back to 16th century Germany
column150: is chocolate cake brushed with cherry Schnapps and layered with cherries (or
column152: cherry pie filling) and whipped cream.  By the middle of the 20th century
column153: it was Germany's best-known cake and had also become well-known in the U. S.
column154: particularly in cities popular among German emigrés.  These days
column155: black forest cake has all but disappeared from the mainstream
column156: although we did find this recipe from Sally's Baking Addiction
column157: and fans of the arguably perfect combination of chocolate and cherry can get their fix with our recipe for Molten Lava Chocolate Cherry Cake. 23 German Chocolate CakeChocolate aficionados might take issue with the name ""German Chocolate Cake"" because this very sweet and mild layer cake gets at least as much
column159: flavor from pecans and coconut.  Still others might take issue with the fact that ""German"" doesn't refer to the country but to the last name of the guy who invented the particular baking chocolate with which this cake was first made.  Nevertheless
column160: German Chocolate Cake was an American favorite during the mid-20th century.  It's rarely seen these days
column161: haven taken a backseat to far more chocolatey chocolate desserts.  But it's as delicious as it ever was
column162: and we found a great recipe for it from Sally's Baking Addiction. Got questions about chocolate? We've got answers
column163: lots and lots of answers. 24 Fresh Berries with ZabaioneFresh Berries with Zabaione (also spelled ""Zabaglione"") is a traditional Italian dessert consisting of fresh berries
column164: drizzled generously with a custard-y sauce composed of just three ingredients: egg yolks
column166: and marsala wine (although some variations use port wine or moscato d'asti).  Although zabaione dates back to 15th century Italy
column167: it was causing quite a stir back in the late 1970s through the early 1980s
column168: when it was as much a default dessert order for some as tiramisu seems to have become.  Some even say that tiramisu derived from zabaione. Although it's hard to find today
column169: you can make it yourself with this recipe from Tania's Kitchen.  Or
column170: if you prefer a healthier version of an Italian-inspired strawberry delivery system
column171: then you'll want to try our recipe for Strawberries with Mascarpone Cream. 25 FruitcakeWe can't say fruitcake has ever been ""forgotten
column172: exactly.  Fruitcake has always been around
column173: and folks are very conscious of that around Christmastime.  The problem is that many regard the prospect of eating fruitcake with a least some measure of trepidation.  And that's putting it mildly.  But it doesn't have to be that way.  Fruitcake
column174: when it's homemade with fresh ingredients
column175: can be quite the revelation.  Don't believe us? You could try making it yourself…Get the recipe from A Beautiful Plate.  For more

column1: 2020-09-16 12:15:14#world#Younger Ostriches Bring Party Vibe to Australian Zoo#https://news.yahoo.com/younger-ostriches-bring-party-vibe-121514952.html#https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/jmgGbeJ4SDxzwzDlj5Z.7g--~B/aD0xMDgwO3c9MTkyMDtzbT0xO2FwcGlkPXl0YWNoeW9u/https://s.yimg.com/hd/cp-video-transcode/prod/2020-09/16/5f6203426f94b9239c97da1c/5f6203697e53b500010a8db5_1920x1080_FES_v1.jpg#en#1.0#news.yahoo.com#For a long time
column2: the Werribee Open Range Zoo had a relatively senior cohort of ostriches.  The arrival of some feisty young males has “truly impressed” staff
column3: the zoo said
column4: especially when they break out their dance moves.  Video released by the zoo on September 16 shows the dancing behavior
column5: which involves males dropping to the ground
column6: fanning their wings and swaying from side to side.  According to zookeper Katie Jones
column7: the dancing is a territorial or courtship behavior.  “Ostriches are typically nomadic but around breeding season we see an increase of territorial displays
column8: ” Jones said.  Older ostriches
column9: she said
column10: are happy to leave “the dancing to the testosterone-filled younger boys. ” Among those
column11: the zoo said
column12: is Frank
column13: who is celebrating his 27th birthday soon.  “Ostriches have a lifespan of 40–50 years
column14: so our older boys – Frank and Pinky – are roughly middle-aged
column15: ” Jones said.  Credit: Werribee Open Range Zoo via Storyful#https://sunnybot.org/goodnews/web/en/ImnTVF2XG#ImnTVF2XG#255#23#3149#0#0

column1: 2020-09-08 15:48:11#world#Make Your Beauty Routine More Effective With This One Simple Challenge#https://www.yahoo.com/lifestyle/beauty-routine-more-effective-one-154811227.html#https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/2o.Y.ZJsnNsLMMdAZA6R4g--~B/aD0xMDI0O3c9MTAyNDthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--/https://media.zenfs.com/en-US/refinery29_778/b48663ef68bf0ea0ec3d2c3ed08b31d9#en#1.0#www.yahoo.com#As a beauty editor
column2: I’ve tried some pretty extreme self-care practices in the name of serviceable journalism (“We Tried [insert unheard-of beauty treatment here]
column3: So You Don’t Have To”).  So
column4: when Crabtree & Evelyn recently tasked me with approaching self-care through a simpler lens — one that only required a mere shift in my perspective — I was intrigued.  The challenge? Channel each of the five senses — sight
column5: smell
column6: hearing
column7: taste
column8: and touch — with my self-care practices throughout the week to see how it affected my overall mood and if it breathed any new life into my regular routine.  Would paying more attention to the feel of each skin-care product I used change my application of it? Would being more intentional about the scents I sought out help me better de-stress? Equipped with a fresh mindset and beauty products from Crabtree & Evelyn
column9: a brand that prides itself on using special ingredients to create these unique
column10: transformative textures (and its new look — a major rebranding done with the intention to return to its naturalistic roots — is so chic)
column11: I sought to find out.  See how it all went down
column12: below.  As someone who tends to speed through her skin-care routine in the morning (anything to get to my first cup of coffee quicker)
column13: I decided to slow down and appreciate the different textures and consistencies of all my various steps — like the way my toner forms a thin puddle in my palm before I press it into my skin or how my moisturizer
column14: which is more viscous in consistency
column15: spreads across my face like warm butter.  Allowing myself time to appreciate the various textures
column16: I was also allowing more time for absorption.  When I think of the type of product that lends itself most to an indulgent application experience
column18: I think of a rich body crème.  So
column19: I grabbed my Crabtree & Evelyn Velvet Body Melt and mentally transported myself to the spa (physically
column20: my bathroom).  Upon opening the jar
column21: I was hit with the fresh scent of roses
column23: and vetiver.  I dug my fingers into the tub
column24: leaving behind a very satisfying imprint in the thick balm.  When I spread the cream onto my legs
column25: it melted into a silky oil
column26: effortlessly gliding across my skin (I credit the soothing murumuru butter and softening mallow in the formula for that).  Transforming from a rich
column27: indulgent cream into a slippery-smooth oil
column28: this unique hydrator left my skin feeling thirst-quenched and thoroughly pampered
column29: from head to toe. Takeaway: When it comes to application order
column30: there’s a general rule that you start with lightweight products and work your way towards the heaviest
column31: which allows for each one to properly sink in.  Paying more attention to the consistencies of my products forced me to adopt a leisurely pace.  It felt like I was making the most out of each one
column32: and it made for a more relaxing
column33: spa-like experience. DashDividers_1_500x100DashDividers_1_500x100Whether it’s a news podcast
column36: I am constantly listening to something.  So much so
column37: that it’s often hard for me to turn my brain off at night.  In an attempt to be more mindful about the sounds I surround myself with
column38: I decided to retire the headphones for the day and listen to the natural sounds of the world around me
column39: instead — by going on a nature walk.  I swiped on a hydrating lip balm (since my lips are always chapped)
column42: and headed out to a tree-lined dirt road a few minutes away. As I wandered down the path
column43: I paid extra attention to every little sound.  I listened to the twigs snap and leaves crunch beneath my feet.  I noticed the way my shoes sunk ever so slightly into the damp ground from the previous night’s rain storm.  I listened to the birds singing their many medleys
column46: singsongy whistles.  I heard the tall marsh plants brush against each other in the breeze and the soft lapping of the water in the nearby pond.  It was a full-on symphony. Takeaway: Getting fresh air and listening to the natural sounds around me
column48: was such an effective way to feel immediately present.  It left me with a feeling of mindfulness that lingered long after I returned home.  Not to mention
column49: my screen time for the day plummeted
column50: which always feels like a win. DashDividers_1_500x100DashDividers_1_500x100There is no rhyme or reason to my skin-care storage.  I keep my most-used products randomly spread out around my sink in whatever position I last left them
column51: with no designated parking spot to return to after each use.  So today
column52: I decided to tap into my inner beauty influencer and arrange my skin-care collection in the most aesthetically pleasing way possible — which
column53: after scrolling through a mere fraction of the 2. 4 million TopShelf posts on IG
column54: I decided was color-coordination. Upon starting this endeavor
column55: it became immediately clear to me that most of my skin-care products fall into two color categories: earthy tones and millennial pink (save a few outliers
column56: of course).  In order to make the most of this organizational method
column57: I decided to store the products that didn’t fit into either category and highlighted only those that did.  After arranging the black bottles by similar shape and by height order
column58: and mirroring the same placements with the pink products
column59: I was left with a satisfyingly chic arrangement.  Honestly
column60: it was harder than it looked!Takeaway: While the end result was certainly a visual upgrade
column61: this was probably the least practical experiment of the challenge thus far.  Color-coordinating my products meant having to table a few essentials that I would normally keep close at hand.  So unless your skin-care collection conveniently hits the full spectrum of a rainbow palette
column62: I’d say stick to organizing by product type or in order of your routine
column65: very tied: If you’re conscious of what you put in your body
column66: you’re likely conscious of what you put on your skin
column67: as well.  Many who seek out things like free radical-fighting antioxidants in skin-care products will do the same with the foods they ingest
column71: I decided to treat my tastebuds to a triple-berry smoothie
column72: swapping out my usual bowl of cereal for more nutrient-based energy in the a. m.
column73: instead.  Dark-berry fruits are high in fiber and packed with antioxidants and vitamins
column74: and I felt much more energized — and satisfyingly full — after finishing it. For my morning caffeine fix
column75: I poured myself some iced coffee.  To make my cold brew slightly sweeter — and give it an autumn-inspired spin — I added a dash of Crabtree & Evelyn’s Fresh Harvest Syrup
column78: sweet-but-spicy blend of maple and ginger derived from a Vermont-based maple syrup farm that served as a perfect
column79: more special alternative to regular table sugar (plus
column80: ginger has a ton of proven health benefits).  derived from local maple syrup farm in VermontFinally
column81: to make the most of the day’s theme
column82: I applied a gourmand-inspired face mask to energize my skin: Crabtree & Evelyn’s Revitalise + Pulp Polish Face Mask.  The bouncy
column83: marmalade-like formula is jam-packed with fruit to help restore skin’s natural glow
column84: featuring apple complex to exfoliate and moisturize
column85: apricot seed powder to gently polish
column86: and blackcurrant seed oil to keep soften skin with protective Omega-6s.  It smelled so good that I was tempted to eat it.  (I didn’t. ) I massaged the gel-like mask onto my skin
column87: activating the apple complex and allowing the finely milled apricot seed powder to gently buff away dead skin cells.  After washing it off 15 minutes later
column88: my skin felt noticeably smoother and appeared extra plump. Takeaway: If today taught me anything
column89: it’s that if your skin-care ingredient list reads like a smoothie recipe
column90: you’re probably onto something good.  I felt much more refreshed after focusing on nourishing myself from the inside out. DashDividers_1_500x100DashDividers_1_500x100Scent — along with being extremely subjective (one whiff of my first-ever fragrance sends me right back to middle school) — is a powerful way to influence your mood.  So for the final leg of this challenge
column91: I decided to dabble in the world of aromatherapy and seek out scents that would help me feel more productive
column93: or awake. I started the day by spritzing on an earthy
column94: uplifting scent: Crabtree & Evelyn’s Raw Instinct Scent has notes of zingy apple
column97: wood base that gives it depth and longevity to last — and evolve — throughout the day.  I misted the subtly sweet
column98: airy scent onto my wrists and let it settle into my skin. While working
column99: I sprinkled cinnamon (improves concentration!) on top of my coffee and broke out the peppermint tea (stimulates mind!) to pick me up out of my midday slump.  By the end of the day
column100: I was ready to fully wind down.  I curled up in my bed
column102: and broke out a massive candle to set the vibe.  Featuring ginger flower
column105: this particular candle was just spicy enough to keep me alert as I read
column108: to help me drift off to sleep soon after. Takeaway: I’m so used to associating smell with nostalgia and memories that it was fascinating to try scents in a much more proactive way.  My next challenge? Expanding my essential oil collection.  DashDividers_1_500x100Like what you see? How about some more R29 goodness

column4: cultural ceremonies

column7: by its very nature

column1: 2020-09-01 20:42:30#world#9 Easiest Ways to Start Eating Healthy#https://www.yahoo.com/lifestyle/9-easiest-ways-start-eating-204230930.html#https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/ZIW54UCEVdCKlYLLT1aIlw--~B/aD04Nzk7dz0xMjAwO2FwcGlkPXl0YWNoeW9u/https://media.zenfs.com/en-US/galvanized/4f50d316c0ac986f1bc09efc55729685#en#1.0#www.yahoo.com#There is no scientific evidence that proves diets work for the long term.  Sure
column2: you'll see fast results if you try some kind of fad diet
column3: but it won't last long.  Diets aren't sustainable
column4: which is why it's important to learn healthy eating habits for the long term. Eating healthy is about balance.  It's about enjoying a glass of wine and not feeling guilty about it.  It's about learning how to intuitively eat
column5: listening to your body's cues
column6: and not attaching emotions to any of your meals.  Healthy eating habits can be cultivated with a few simple changes—changes that won't feel overwhelming or restrictive on your eating.  We now know that restricted eating doesn't work
column7: so instead
column8: here are a few healthy eating habits you can incorporate into daily life that will lead you closer to a healthier lifestyle.  And yes
column9: it can even help with losing those pesky extra pounds. 1 Stock up on healthy snacks. Snacking is inevitable
column10: we all love to do it! Craving a little afternoon snack (or a mid-morning bite between breakfast and lunch) shouldn't be the reason we turn to salty and fatty junk foods.  Instead
column11: stock your pantry with healthier snacks you truly enjoy.  Fruit and peanut butter are obviously great options
column12: but you could also snag popcorn
column15: and snap pea crisps. 2 Fill half your plate with veggies. Pile on the veggies! Not only does it fill your plate up quickly
column16: but it also provides a ton of nutrients.  Plus
column17: they're low in calories.  Salad greens are easy
column18: but you could also add roasted vegetables like Brussels sprouts
column23: and more. 3 Drink water throughout the day. Water wards off dehydration (which causes you to want to eat more)
column24: but it's also incredibly important for your digestion.  Plus
column25: if you're drinking water throughout the day
column26: you're less likely to drink other sugary drinks—like soda and sugary cocktails.  Not sure how much you need to be drinking? Here's an easy way to calculate how much water to drink. 4 Make frozen smoothie packs. Making smoothies is a lot easier when you have the supplies on hand! Stock up your freezer with some of your favorite frozen fruits
column27: or even divide up some frozen fruits in smoothie packs.  One easy smoothie pack to make includes 1/2 banana
column29: and 1 cup of kale (loosely packed).  When you're reading for a smoothie
column30: mix with 1 cup of unsweetened almond milk and either 1 tablespoon of peanut butter or 1 scoop of protein powder.  This works well as a snack
column31: but can even be filling enough for a meal!5 Swap with whole grains. Whole-grain carbohydrates are loaded with dietary fiber
column32: which is the best food you can have for weight loss.  Swapping out your white
column33: refined carbohydrates for whole-grain carbohydrates and complex carbs is actually a lot easier than you think.  You can find whole-grain pasta
column37: and more. 6 Roast sheet pan dinners. Frying and sauteeing are easy ways to cook dinner
column39: you can easily load it up with lots of oil
column40: which piles on the calories.  Instead
column41: roast your dinner in the oven on a sheet pan.  Sheet pan dinners are easy to throw together and easy in terms of controlling how much oil you end up using.  Plus
column43: and the dish clean-up later is minimal. RELATED: Your ultimate supermarket survival guide is here!7 Sip on seltzer. Water is good to drink
column44: but it can get boring pretty quickly.  Find a few seltzers you love that can change up your usual water-drinking routine.  Plus
column46: you can easily replace your sugary sodas and other beverages that are full of empty calories. 8 Portion your food. Portioning out your food doesn't mean restricting your food! It means properly portioning out the right amount of food for each meal.  For a normal lunch of dinner plate
column47: it's good to have at least 4 to 5 oz.  of protein
column49: 1/2 cup (or 1 serving) of a complex carb
column50: and a serving of healthy fats.  This plate is full and filling
column51: and you won't feel like you're missing out. 9 Choose one dessert for the day. Have a sweet tooth? You don't have to eliminate your favorite sweets completely.  Just like portioning out your food
column52: plan your dessert for the day and portion it correctly.  If you love ice cream
column53: have a scoop of ice cream.  Dark chocolate? Enjoy a serving of it.  Are you more of a brownie person? Enjoy one warmed up with a dollop of whipped cream.  It will satisfy your sweet craving and you won't overdo it on the calories. Or make your own sweet treat from our list of 73+ Best Healthy Dessert Recipes. #https://sunnybot.org/goodnews/web/en/TOFUBbTD8#TOFUBbTD8#44#4#648#0#0

column1: 2020-09-06 13:27:31#world#Where to find the world's most soul-stirring sunrises#https://www.yahoo.com/lifestyle/where-worlds-most-soul-stirring-132731877.html#https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/wXE0VkRJlpO_cruB8wst3w--~B/aD02MjU7dz0xMDAwO2FwcGlkPXl0YWNoeW9u/https://media.zenfs.com/en-GB/the_telegraph_818/8ad6bea0ef03afd607a7a268d593195f#en#1.0#www.yahoo.com#There is something special about witnessing the sunrise
column2: in watching those first fingers of pale yellow light pull at the edges of a blanket of darkness.  You don’t have to be a solstice-bothering modern-day Druid to experience the sense of renewal that it brings; dawn is the purest expression of a fresh start
column3: a chance to do things differently
column4: to watch a brand new day begin to unfold.  Perhaps some of this psychological cleansing comes from the fact that you will almost certainly have to put in a bit of effort
column5: or find yourself doing something out of the ordinary
column6: to witness this daily phenomenon.  For those of us lucky enough not to work night shifts
column7: seeking out a spectacular sunrise may require an alarm clock
column8: plenty of coffee and a journey in the dark
column9: wrapped up warm.  Does that make it a more satisfying event than sunset
column10: with all its gaudy brilliance
column11: witnessed with friends over a drink
column12: by a beach
column13: as half the world begins its slumbers? Let’s not compare the two.  But it’s certainly true that you will be in good company for your early start
column14: as a dawn chorus of birds joins you in salute.  They are welcoming the day
column15: just as you are – and as the writers below do
column16: in a celebration of the most memorable sunrises they have experienced around the world. #https://sunnybot.org/goodnews/web/en/I5vMsQYyM#I5vMsQYyM#171#2#2631#0#0

column2: Ohio
column3: on Monday
column4: August 31
column5: with one goat
column6: Alex
column7: surprising her by standing on a swing while the other
column8: Junior
column9: tackled an inflatable deer hanging next to it.  Speaking to Storyful
column10: owner Tammy Tunison said “Junior loves head-butting the deer
column11: which he thinks is a goat
column12: ” but said she filmed this moment because it was the first time Alex stood on the swing.  Tunison purchased a swing made for toddlers
column13: but figured figured it was “a perfect size” for her animals.  “My goats loved it
column14: ” she said.  “Alex was the first one to try the swing.  He learned right away how to get on it
column15: ” she added.  “As I was filming I realized…he was using his head
column17: and butt to make the swing move.  I could not believe it.  A goat that can swing himself.  He did this for over 30 minutes!
column18: ” Tunison said.  Credit: Tammy Tunison via Storyful#https://sunnybot.org/goodnews/web/en/yZ1lVuuLL#yZ1lVuuLL#74#4#4626#0#0

column1: 2020-09-03 20:03:59#world#14 Iconic Fast-Food Items That Changed Our Lives Forever#https://www.yahoo.com/lifestyle/14-iconic-fast-food-items-200359589.html#https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/DC4pwUdFHS6Mgdw0.fKtTw--~B/aD04Nzk7dz0xMjAwO2FwcGlkPXl0YWNoeW9u/https://media.zenfs.com/en-US/galvanized/522388f6ba714fd198dc6d74c680eb4e#en#1.0#www.yahoo.com#"As fast food has evolved
column2: we can pinpoint several seminal inventions that changed the industry and our expectations as consumers forever.  The archetypal burger
column3: the longest-standing fast food dessert
column4: the first stuffed-crust pizza
column5: the sandwich with an unforgettable value .  .  .  all of these items have earned their rightful place in the fabric of our food culture. Here's a look back at some of the most defining moments in modern American fast food
column6: one iconic item at a time. For more
column7: check out 15 Classic American Desserts That Deserve a Comeback. Don't forget to sign up for our newsletter to get the latest restaurant news delivered straight to your inbox. 1 McDonald's Big MacProbably the most iconic burger on the planet
column8: the Big Mac from McDonald's is the OG fast food burger.  It's the burger that taught us what fast food burgers could look like.  Now in its 52nd year
column9: the signature burger is ordered a whopping 550 million times annually.  Once you dissect it
column10: however
column11: it's pretty simple—two beef patties
column12: special sauce
column16: on a sesame bun.  Here's What Happens to Your Body When You Eat a Big Mac Every Day. 2 Popeyes Chicken SandwichThis iconic chicken sandwich was only rolled out last year
column17: but it has already gone down in American fast food history as the most buzzed about fast food item of the past decade.  Sure
column19: perfectly crispy piece of chicken nestled between a brioche bun with pickles and mayo
column20: but what this sandwich actually showed us is that in this day and age
column21: it isn't enough to simply taste good
column22: you also need to have a savvy social media presence.  Once Popeye's tweeted ""y'all good?"" at their main competitor Chick-fil-A
column23: the sandwich was well on its way to selling out within two weeks of launching.  Read more about the iconic sandwich here. 3 Taco Bell's Doritos Locos TacosOnce Taco Bell decided to collaborate with another food icon—Doritos—it was only a matter of time before they were to create the chain's most popular menu item.  Doritos Locos Tacos were added to the restaurant's menu in 2012 and have since sold in the billions.  Actually
column24: it's been reported that about a million are sold EACH DAY.  Talk about a restaurant that knows its audience.  Here's why Your Favorite Taco Bell Location Is About to Look Very Different. 4 Subway's $5 FootlongSubway's subs wouldn't be what they are had it not been for the ingenious 2008 promotional campaign that touted their incredible value—for a mere $5
column25: you get a foot-long sandwich.  Unfortunately
column27: the types of subs you can get for this price and the participating locations have dwindled.  While the $5 Footlong is mostly gone from Subway
column28: this product (and its catchy jingle) really put the restaurant's sandwiches on the map. 5 McDonald's Apple PieOne of the fast food desserts with most staying power
column29: the hand-held apple pie from McDonald's has been around for an incredible stretch of 52 years (just like the Big Mac!).  While the recipe has had over 40 different iterations over the years
column30: it has firmly remained in its signature cardboard sleeve.  Today's recipe features a baked lattice crust
column31: and a blend of Golden Delicious
column36: and Fuji apples.  Read more on why You Might've Noticed That McDonald's Apple Pies Taste a Little Different. 6 Dunkin's MunchkinsWe love our non-conventionally shaped baked treats
column37: and Munchkins seem to have filled that hole in our hearts perfectly.  When they started being sold at Dunkin' Donuts in 1972
column38: the adorable donut holes were named after characters from The Wizard of Oz and were primarily marketed to kids.  Nowadays
column39: hordes of fans young and old consume millions of them every year. 7 Sonic's Cherry LimeadeOne of Sonic's most popular menu items is actually a beverage.  The chain's Cherry Limeade
column43: is equal parts delicious and retro
column44: which has garnered it a cult following.  To honor the success they've had with this signature drink
column45: Sonic incorporated cherry-red letters in their new logo this year
column46: while a big neon-lit cherry is now a prominent feature of their updated restaurant design. 8 Burger King's Chicken FriesSure
column47: we've seen bite-sized pieces of perfectly crispy chicken before with the ubiquitous chicken nuggets
column48: but chicken bits shaped like french fries for ultimate dippability? Now that is some Burger King genius.  After a years-long hiatus
column49: during which fans tirelessly campaigned for their return
column50: the chicken fries came back in 2015 as a permanent menu item.  And we've never looked back since. 9 White Castle's Impossible Slider Before the Impossible Whopper and Dunkin's Beyond Breakfast Sausage Sandwich
column51: there was the Impossible Slider from White Castle.  That's right
column52: White Castle was a pioneer when it came to serving plant-based meat in one of their iconic creations.  The chain started serving the Impossible slider as early as April 2018
column53: before rolling it out nationwide in September of that year.  We Tried the White Castle Impossible Slider.  Here's Our Review. 10 McDonald's Egg McMuffinThe Egg McMuffin is to breakfast fast food what the Big Mac is to fast food burgers.  Invented in 1972 by a franchise owner in Santa Barbara
column55: the breakfast sandwich was meant to resemble Eggs Benedict.  But it became so much more than an imitation—a breakfast icon in itself
column56: which has withstood the test of time and prevailed on the McDonald's menu for decades. 11 Starbucks PSLsIn 2003
column57: Starbucks had a brilliant idea: to create a seasonal limited-time Fall drink that'll keep fans coming back year after year.  Hence
column58: the Pumpkin Spice Latte was born.  The PSL has become as synonymous with Fall as apple pie
column59: and is actually credited with propelling the pumpkin spice flavor into a full-fledged cultural phenomenon. 12 Panda Express' Orange ChickenPanda Express struck gold with the invention of Orange Chicken
column60: which straddles both Chinese and American flavor palettes perfectly with its unique sweet
column62: and savory notes.  Developed in 1987 by chef Andy Kho
column63: the dish capitalizes on its Chinese inspiration and American craveability factor.  And it has become so synonymous with Chinese cuisine
column64: you'll find it on most Chinese restaurant menus nationwide.  Read why This Is the Safest Restaurant Chain Right Now. 13 KFC's Double DownThe no-bun
column65: double-chicken sandwich was the very first fast food sandwich served without bread.  As such
column66: it's credited with providing limitless fast food inspiration
column67: showing that anything is possible (and sellable).  And while we appreciate this bacon-cheese-chicken sandwich for what it meant for American ingenuity
column68: it's no longer available at KFC. 14 Pizza Hut's Stuffed Crust PizzaPossibly the food innovation of the century
column69: stuffing the pizza crust with cheese is one of Pizza Hut's (and fast food's) most iconic moments.  The seminal work took place in 1995
column70: and the landscape of pizza has never quite been the same.  We now want our pie to surprise and delight us just like it did back then. "#https://sunnybot.org/goodnews/web/en/BvQHhmhSL#BvQHhmhSL#202#13#20201#0#0

column1: 2020-09-04 11:25:01#world#Beautiful oriole enjoys an orange at this ingeniously simple bird feeder#https://www.yahoo.com/lifestyle/beautiful-oriole-enjoys-orange-ingeniously-112501440.html#https://s.yimg.com/ny/api/res/1.2/aHQ.cgg6.eW31pAYbPKZ5g--/YXBwaWQ9aGlnaGxhbmRlcjt3PTEyODA7aD03MjA-/https://s.yimg.com/hd/cp-video-transcode/prod/2020-09/04/5f522562c485b35026be160d/5f522562c485b35026be160e_o_U_v2.jpg#en#1.0#www.yahoo.com#"Orioles are one of the most vividly coloured birds in North America.  They are also very simple to attract to any back yard.  They adore brightly coloured fruit such as mango
column2: oranges
column3: and red grapes.  This ingenious feeder is as simple as slicing an orange in half and sticking it on a tree branch.  Orioles will seek out the best places to feed and they will even bring their young to the same spots.  Orioles have a unique and interesting method of feeding
column4: referred to as ""gaping"".  Although they do eat by closing their beaks around food
column5: they also use their beaks in the opposite direction
column6: inserting the tip into soft food such as a orange and then opening their beaks to create a trough or ""gape"".  This gape fills with juice which they slurp up or eat by using their beaks in typical fashion.  Orioles are also very fond of grape jelly
column7: which can be used to lure them to a back yard feeder.  With just a little research

column1: 2020-09-02 13:00:48#world#8 Fastest Crock-Pot Freezer Meals-Ever#https://www.yahoo.com/lifestyle/8-fastest-crock-pot-freezer-130048817.html#https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/Jv.JtjTx0IOVIGmMlgyGkQ--~B/aD04Nzk7dz0xMjAwO2FwcGlkPXl0YWNoeW9u/https://media.zenfs.com/en-US/galvanized/1cf593eae0c78ae2f369fc1684c2a84d#en#1.0#www.yahoo.com#Who doesn't love warming up with a good slow cooker meal? Especially if you can prep Crock-Pot freezer meals and save them for later!Making Crock-Pot freezer meals is easy to do.  You need to purchase some gallon-size plastic bags that work well in the freezer.  Add in the ingredients (including the sauces) into the freezer bag and seal.  Just make sure that the air is squeezed out of the bag before freezing them. Before you plan on cooking the meal
column2: you'll want to defrost the meal in the refrigerator for 24 hours before cooking it.  Most of these crock-pot freezer meals call for added chicken
column3: beef
column4: or vegetable stock when you cook the meal.  This would be added after dumping the bag of ingredients into the slow cooker
column5: so make sure to read the instructions before turning the Crock-Pot on. Here are 8 easy Crock-Pot freezer meal recipes (and if desired
column6: you can freeze and prep for later).  Seriously
column7: this is the easiest way to meal-prep homemade dinners in advance!1 Crock-Pot Beef RaguGetting sick of your usual spaghetti and red sauce dinner? Take it up a notch with this fancy slow cooker beef ragu recipe! The best part? column1: 2020-08-25 16:20:06#world#13 Genius Ice Cube Tray Hacks That'll Blow Your Mind#https://www.yahoo.com/lifestyle/13-genius-ice-cube-tray-162006221.html#https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/KtA0AUMsVbAP2L9YLNYN9A--~B/aD04Nzk7dz0xMjAwO2FwcGlkPXl0YWNoeW9u/https://media.zenfs.com/en-US/galvanized/dbb0b0dd02a56de72f52e7408615c783#en#1.0#www.yahoo.com#"When you think about an ice cube tray
column2: well
column3: the concept of creating ice to pop into your drinks is all that comes to mind.  However
column4: your handy
column5: reusable cube-maker can be used for so many more hacks than just simply chilling water. ""Freezing things this way in an ice cube tray is a great way to use leftover bits and bobs and to have them portioned for the future.  You can let the cubes freeze solid
column6: at least overnight
column7: then pop them out and store them in a zipper-lock bag if you want to use your tray for something else
column8: says Hannah Crowley
column9: executive editor of tastings and testings at America's Test Kitchen in Brookline
column10: Massachusetts. So yes
column11: there are tons of ice cube tray hacks that you might be surprised to uncover how much these trays can do! Try these 13 tricks to make the most of your ice cube tray and create flavor-filled food in a flash.  And for more hacks
column12: don't miss these 52 Life-Changing Kitchen Hacks That'll Make You Enjoy Cooking Again. 1 Chill coffee without watering it down""Chilling coffee with regular ice cubes can lead to a watered-down product.  Freezing brewed coffee in ice cube trays allows you to add that 'ice
column14: it's a continual dose of coffee
column16: executive chef at Auguste Escoffier School of Culinary Arts. If you prefer your coffee with a splash of dairy
column20: California. RELATED: Sign up for our newsletter to get daily recipes and food news in your inbox!2 Preserve leftover wineHave some bonus Beaujolais? Pour it into small portions for easy access later on. ""I like to store wine in an ice cube tray
column21: Crowley says.  ""It's a good way to use up the last bit of a bottle
column23: and then I have some the next time I want to make a pan sauce or some soup.  That way I don't have to use any of whatever I'm drinking that night!""RELATED: Your ultimate restaurant and supermarket survival guide is here!3 Save stockIf you've gone through the effort of simmering up a pot of homemade stock or broth
column24: you want to make the most of it
column25: and that's where the ice cube tray comes in. ""I like to make a big batch of stock and store the leftovers in ice trays.  This allows you to choose the quantity you need
column26: so you don't have to thaw large portions
column27: Hayes says. RELATED: This 7-day smoothie diet will help you shed those last few pounds. 4 Extend the life of herbsStore herbs in broth
column29: or oil—the possibilities are truly endless! Dice herbs and cover with some liquid substance
column30: then freeze to preserve summer's best to use all year long.  Try the herb cubes melted into soups
column33: or simply melt a pat atop a grilled steak. 5 Baby your DIY baby foodInstead of grabbing a jar
column34: defrost a couple of cubes. ""I enjoy making my child's food—and knowing that it was made from scratch with fresh ingredients
column35: Hayes says.  She dedicates a day to meal prep a few different items (such as sweet potatoes
column39: and then freeze each in a separate ice cube tray. ""This way
column40: my kid can have a variety of items in one day
column41: and they're all quick to heat up
column42: she says. And when you don't have time to make it homemade
column43: here are The Best Baby Food Brands to Buy
column44: According to Nutritionists. 6 Make the most of fruitBerries and bananas can go bad before you know it
column45: so freezing them in cubes is a way to make them last a lot longer than they typically would. ""Purée and freeze fresh fruit at its prime
column46: then try these as a replacement for store-bought frozen fruit for smoothies
column48: you can pour the final few ounces of your 100% fruit juice into a tray and freeze it to later use them to top seltzers or cocktails with colorful
column49: tasty cubes. 7 Build better buttermilk pancakesA typical single-serving homemade pancake recipe calls for about 1/3 cup of buttermilk.  Too bad it often comes in half-gallon containers
column50: right? The solution: Fill one-ounce wells two-thirds of the way full with the rest of the bottle of buttermilk
column51: then defrost four cubes to build batter for another short stack any time. And while you're making flapjacks
column52: check out these 13 Common Pancake Mistakes—and How to Fix Them. 8 Waste no more egg whitesUsing egg yolks for custards
column54: or hollandaise? Preserve the whites for another day by filling each ice cube well with one white.  Then
column55: you can thaw as many as you need for your recipe in the fridge overnight and use them to add a protein boost to your menu. Use egg whites as the ""glue"" for spices on candied nuts
column56: combine them with whole eggs to bring a stir-fry together
column57: or scramble them with leftover vegetables and proteins. 9 Build a better (stiffer) bourbon drinkCalling all cocktail aficionados: Stock up on larger or spherical ice cube trays. ""A ball of ice is better than a cube because the less surface area that is exposed to the warm liquid
column58: the slower the ice will melt.  A sphere of ice will melt slightly slower than a cube of ice
column59: so you can chill the drink without quickly diluting it
column61: chef at Umami Burger in Los Angeles
column62: California. 10 Create crystal-clear cocktail coolersIf you want your ice to be as clear and cool as your favorite cocktail bar
column63: try Crowley's trick. ""Restaurant ice is bubble-free if it comes from commercial ice machines that have purifiers and freeze the water really fast
column64: she says.  ""You can make similarly-sharp cubes at home by boiling distilled water and freezing it—no need to cool first.  This makes clear ice
column65: like all the fancy bars serve now
column66: and the clear ice actually stays frozen longer than regular ice
column67: making it perfect for cocktails. ""11 Chill caramelized onionsA bit nutty
column69: a bit tangy—caramelized onions lend a delicious flavor to soups
column71: and pasta.  What we're not so wild about is the 45 minutes or so it takes to get them lusciously jammy.  Luckily
column72: they freeze up just fine if you pack them into ice cube wells tightly—no other ingredients required.  Caramelize several onions at once
column73: then store in a zip-top bag (with as much of the air pressed out as possible) in the freezer for up to three months. 12 Make speedy chocolate-covered strawberriesBakery-bought chocolate-covered strawberries can cost upwards of $3 each.  Try this ice cube tray hack to save cash. Combine two cups of chocolate chips with two tablespoons of coconut oil and microwave at 45-second intervals at 50% power until melted
column74: stirring between each shift. Fill each of the 12 ice cube wells a little over half full with the chocolate mixture
column77: on top to coat most of the sides of the berry. Freeze until the chocolate is solid
column78: then pop them out and dig in. 13 Make H2O happier with infused iceDress up your daily dose of water with some spiffed-up cubes. ""Freeze citrus juice and zest
column80: or even edible flowers in water to make your drink a little fancier
column81: Hayes says.  Who doesn't love a daily dose of spa water

column2: Maryland
column3: were joined by some unusual bathers this summer — a herd of wild horses.  The herd can be seen on the beach with the surf lapping at their legs in this video uploaded to Facebook on July 20 by Karen DePace.  “This is the first time in 10 years that I personally have seen them [the horses] playing in the ocean
column4: ” Maryland resident DePace told Storyful.  DePace said that three park rangers were with the horses “to ensure their safety” as they cooled off in the water.  She said it was a “very hot day. ” The horses are descendants of domestic animals that reverted to a wild state
column5: according to the National Park Service
column6: who encourage visitors to the island to “enjoy their beauty from a distance. ” Credit: Karen DePace via Storyful#https://sunnybot.org/goodnews/web/en/vwwMcCeZp#vwwMcCeZp#45#1#6429#0#0

column2: the black rabbit waits until he can resume walking alongside his friend.  The baby deer continues to follow the path at Cowichan Valley
column3: British Columbia
column4: Canada
column5: with his furry friend hopping along side him -- reminiscent of Disney characters Bambi and Thumper who strike up a friendship during a walk in the woods. Filmed on 17th June 2020#https://sunnybot.org/goodnews/web/en/wQYnYXnAe#wQYnYXnAe#98#2#1153#0#0

column1: 2020-07-26 11:00:00#world#Rescued sea lions and sea elephant return to sea in Argentina#https://www.yahoo.com/lifestyle/rescued-sea-lions-sea-elephant-110000371.html#https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/62efSP0TGcH8drPPxSU3tQ--~B/aD03MjA7dz0xMjgwO3NtPTE7YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b24-/https://s.yimg.com/hd/cp-video-transcode/prod/2020-07/27/5f1f18a66f94b9292853a129/5f1f18a66f94b9292853a12a_o_U_v2.jpg#en#1.0#www.yahoo.com#"This is the heartwarming return of four sea lions and a sea elephant
column2: rescued in recent weeks from freshwaters in the towns of Gualeguaychú in Argentina on July 26
column3: and through the coordination of various institutions and the accompaniment of the National Environment portfolio
column4: were returned to their habitat. ""We came to accompany the task of the inspectors and the Environmental Control brigade of the Ministry
column5: who carry out an exemplary task taking care of the environment
column6: protecting the fauna and controlling contaminating activities throughout the country
column7: stressed the Minister of Environment. The first of the sea lions to appear was spotted by local residents on a road by the Gualeguaychú river
column8: in the town of the same name in the province of Entre Ríos.  Days later
column9: Ambiente participated in a new rescue operation for another specimen that was circulating in a private neighborhood located on the banks of the Luján River in the Buenos Aires municipality of Escobar.  The other two sea lions and the elephant seal were found in the following days in the Paraná delta area of ​​the Tigre district
column10: province of Buenos Aires. The Civil Defense of Escobar and Tigre
column11: the Tigre Operations Center (COT) and the Félix de Azara and Temaikèn foundations participated in the relief and assistance of the different animals
column12: in the rescue center the first veterinary controls were carried out.  Once stabilized
column13: a specialized team of inspectors from the national Ministry of Environment transferred the specimens to the Mundo Marino Foundation
column14: where they remained until the present reintegration into the sea. The five animals had entered the delta of the Paraná River.  It is estimated that the reasons that led marine mammals to lose their habitat could be related to climatic events such as storms or floods or extraordinary downspouts
column15: or due to the low supply of food in salty waters that ended up moving them away from their reference routes. "#https://sunnybot.org/goodnews/web/en/WeBqhrdOk#WeBqhrdOk#209#21#16077#0#0

column8: talking

column13: in the kitchen on his drawer
column14: and on his screened-in back porch.  As stated on his website
column15: Einstein’s mission statement: “To entertain and bring joy

column20: einsteinparrot. com is designed to inform you about the care of parrots and also entertain you.  As previously mentioned
column21: Einstein is popular on many social media sites such as YouTube @einsteinparrot
column24: and Facebook @einsteintexanparrot.  Living with a parrot is a big commitment.  Parrots live a very long time.   A parrot such as Einstein can live to be 50 or 60 years old.  Many larger parrots like Macaws can live to be 100 years old.  They all require a lot of care
column28: and patience.  Parrots need a lot of attention and lots of toys and activities to keep from being bored.  Parrots are also expensive
column29: a large cage is an investment
column30: and plenty of play perches to spend out of cage time.  Specialized veterinarian care is also required.  Most of all they require your companionship and a forever home.  Many people decide after the first few years of parrot ownership that the responsibility is too great and the parrots become neglected and sometimes abandoned.  When that happens they are sent to parrot rescue facilities to be adopted by a new family or some spend their lives in sanctuaries.  It is often said
